newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: AGRICULTURAL BANK PLANS SHARE CAPITAL BOOST.
newsitem.headline: AGRICULTURAL BANK PLANS SHARE CAPITAL BOOST.

text.p: Lithuania's state-run Agricultural Bank said on Tuesday that it planned to boost its share capital by 29.225 million litas to 157.225 million litas.
"The bank's board is planning to suggest at the shareholders' meeting on Friday to issue 167,000 shares worth 29.225 million litas," the bank's chairman Vaclovas Litvinas said at a news conference.
The bank is 86.04 percent government-owned and the state will keep the same stake in the new share emission, he said.
The bank reported last Friday that its 1996 net profit fell to 25.5 million litas from 26.46 million litas the previous year.
The government has committed itself to privatising the bank and Litvinas said it would likely happen in 1997.
"According to the preliminary data, the Agricultural Bank will be privatised this year," he said.
He added that the government planned to sell all of its stake.
